text.name: sys_description
text.text: The VTech CreatiVision was a hybrid of computer and second generation video games consoles produced by VTech in 1981. this hybrid unit is similar in concept to computers such as the Family Computer VideoBrain. It features a 8-bit CPU Rockwell 6502 with a speed of 2 MHz, 1 KB RAM and 32 sprites. The console has two controllers integrated with membrane keyboard and joystick. It supports cartridges but also K7s via an adapter. It anticipated the trend of video game consoles to tend more and more towards entry-level computers.
